jobDescription: Be a part of something powerful at America's leading energy provider! At Exelon, our people are the heart and soul of our business. Whether it's powering lives, supporting communities or collaborating with colleagues, an Exelon employee is talented, compassionate, forward-thinking and inspired. We are a Fortune 200 company united by our values and shared vision for a cleaner and brighter future. We encourage curiosity, value diverse perspectives and we never stop looking for ways to be, work and do better. We know the future is in our hands. That's why we're looking for people like you, who have the power to make a difference. As the nation's largest utility company, we serve more than 10 million customers through six fully regulated transmission and distribution utilities -- Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power & Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco). All 18,000 of us are committed to delivering safe, reliable and affordable energy to our customers, strengthening our communities, supporting a clean energy future and reducing our impact on the changing climate. Our people are empowered to evolve and advance their careers in an open and inclusive environment. We pride ourselves on being the kind of place where people want to come, stay and grow -- whether that's in the role and path they start in or in new and exciting career opportunities across our business. We know that investing in our employees' futures strengthens ours, which is why we offer competitive compensation, incentives, opportunities for career path changes, and health and retirement benefits. Primary Purpose Of Position Develops studies, plans, criteria, specifications, calculations, evaluations, design documents, performance assessments, integrated systems analysis, cost estimates, budgets, associated with the planning, design, licensing, construction, commissioning, operation, and maintenance of Exelon's electric generation, transmission, distribution, gas and telecommunication facilities/systems. Provides analytical support and consultation and recommendations to the Company within and to other business units and/or customers as a result of studying company or customer-owned systems, processes, equipment, vehicles or facilities. Reviews financial data for budget and actual costs of projects. Position may be required to work extended hours, including 24 x 7 coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies. Primary Duties And Accountabilities Leads and performs engineering assignments associated with critical engineering projects or a number of small projects with many complex features require extensive company experience that may include leading employees or contractors in the commissioning of electrical systems and equipment to be placed On System. (45%) Performs assignments in areas where engineering precedents are incomplete, lacking or require broad experience. (25%) Evaluates, develops and implements projects that have significant financial and operational impact. (10%) May serve as an expert for organization in a specific area or responsibility that may include the delivery of classroom instruction/training and/or OJT/OJE. (5%) Performs assignments while acting independently, and may lead multi-discipline teams. (5%) Provides recommendations and implements action plans to improve performance and cost effectiveness. (5%) Participates in technical and industry societies and committees to enhance knowledge of new technologies or issues in areas of company interest. (5%) JOB SCOPE Provides technical assistance in support of others. Influence decisions that have a significant impact on the company. Applies technical knowledge to help promote a safe work environment and to enhance customer satisfaction. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a technical field (non-engineer) (1) or equivalent relevant education / experience (See Section Below) (2) AND 6 or more years of field experience in engineering, construction, or applicable utility experience. (1) Examples of technical fields (non-engineer) include Engineering Technology, Electronics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Physics, etc. (2) Relevant education / experience is knowledge and skills that may be acquired through job experiences or education programs related to those acquired through a formal technical degree program. Examples include experience gained in a military role applicable to electric power distribution, completion of a journey-level electrician program (e.g., overhead / underground electrician, electrical mechanic), or completion of a company-sponsored technical education program (e.g., Elements of Electrical Engineering (E3) series). The equivalent relevant education / experience is in addition to the position's minimum experience requirements. Ability to analyze and interpret electrical and mechanical systems. Knowledge and ability to apply problem-solving approaches. Knowledge of construction, operations or engineering principles and practices. Knowledge of complex field test equipment. Broad knowledge and experience with regulations, guides, standards, codes, methods, and practices necessary to perform routine assignments for a specific discipline installations, or service. Equivalent Relevant Education / Experience: Associate's degree in a technical field (1) AND 8 or more years of field experience in engineering, construction or applicable utility experience Non-degreed or non-technical degree equivalent relevant education (2) AND 8 or more years relevant utility experience Equivalent Relevant Education / Experience: Non-degreed or non-technical degree equivalent relevant education (2) AND 8 or more years relevant utility experience Preferred Qualifications Clearly demonstrated team leadership abilities on critical projects. Primary Purpose Of Position The Substation Operations Trainee - Operations NERC works as a member of a crew in the performance of tasks associated with the operation, maintenance, testing , troubleshooting and repair of high voltage substation equipment and controls; power circuit breakers, power transformers, control batteries and chargers, metal-clad switchgear, high voltage busses, fire protection systems, low voltage station service equipment, capacitor banks, and disconnect switches. Minimum Qualifications Experience demonstrating skill using basic math skills (such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division). Ability and willingness to work extended hours, overtime, shift work, weekends, and holidays as required. Ability and willingness to participate in the Company's qualification program. Ability and willingness to read and comprehend Company material and complete written reports accurately. Ability and willingness to communicate clearly with other employees, face to face and over the radio. Ability and willingness to participate in substation modules and computer based (CBT) refresher training. Ability and willingness to perform both indoor and outdoor tasks for extended periods of time (for example, lifting up to 50 pounds, climbing ladders and scaffolding, bending, twisting, kneeling, crawling, pulling/pushing, standing, walking, and squatting). Ability and willingness to work in a variety of work environments including: all weather conditions, around energized electrical substation equipment, at extreme heights (above 30 feet), in confined spaces or enclosed vessels, in dark areas or areas with limited lighting, and in foul water, mud, dust, noxious fumes, noisy, and dirty environments with proper Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). Ability and willingness to adhere to federal, state, local and Company safety rules and regulations and to wear and use safety equipment as required. Ability and willingness to wear an issued uniform. Ability and willingness to travel to various Company locations and job sites. Ability and willingness to distinguish color coded wires, signs, breakers, etc. Must pass Qualification Tests Must possess valid Driver's License. Must successfully pass a Criminal History Background Check This position is a NERC Regulated position. As such, a background check will be conducted on the incumbent every seven years. Additionally, the incumbent will be required to complete annual NERC compliance training. Preferred Qualifications Experience demonstrating skill working as a member of a crew to perform tasks associated with the operation, maintenance, testing, troubleshooting and repair of various equipment. Experience demonstrating knowledge in the fundamentals of electricity. Experience demonstrating skill using hand tools to repair, troubleshoot, and maintain equipment. Experience demonstrating skill assisting in inspecting and/or maintaining mechanical equipment. Experience demonstrating skill using personal computers to perform various tasks. Experience performing administrative/paperwork tasks. Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Be a part of something powerful at America's leading energy provider! At Exelon, our people are the heart and soul of our business. Whether it's powering lives, supporting communities or collaborating with colleagues, an Exelon employee is talented, compassionate, forward-thinking and inspired. We are a Fortune 200 company united by our values and shared vision for a cleaner and brighter future. We encourage curiosity, value diverse perspectives and we never stop looking for ways to be, work and do better. We know the future is in our hands. That's why we're looking for people like you, who have the power to make a difference. As the nation's largest utility company, we serve more than 10 million customers through six fully regulated transmission and distribution utilities -- Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power & Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco). All 18,000 of us are committed to delivering safe, reliable and affordable energy to our customers, strengthening our communities, supporting a clean energy future and reducing our impact on the changing climate. Our people are empowered to evolve and advance their careers in an open and inclusive environment. We pride ourselves on being the kind of place where people want to come, stay and grow -- whether that's in the role and path they start in or in new and exciting career opportunities across our business. We know that investing in our employees' futures strengthens ours, which is why we offer competitive compensation, incentives, opportunities for career path changes, and health and retirement benefits. Primary Purpose Of Position The Tax Analyst has a wide range of responsibility with respect to federal, state and local tax accounting, compliance and research focused on an Exelon business unit and its operating subsidiaries. The position reports directly to the business unit Tax Manager. Primary Duties And Accountabilities Assists with the computes and documenting (via work papers) income tax provision calculations for internal and external management reporting. The documentation includes the completion of Sarbanes Oxley controls and Fin 48 positions. (25%) Assists in the preparation of work papers, schedules, tax returns, or other items related to tax returns or to tax payments necessary to comply with tax laws. (35%) Assists in researching & concluding on various complex tax issues to determine the appropriate tax treatment and related tax reporting. Research includes assisting in preparing written memorandums. (10%) Implements process improvements that promote risk management, streamline activities, and enhance transparency in tax work streams. (10%) Assists in less complex controversy matters with governmental agencies including but not limited to the Internal Revenue Service, Illinois Department of Revenue, and Pennsylvania Department of Revenue. Activities include gathering data requests and formulating position statements with respect to identified controversies raised by tax authorities (10%) Assists with investigations and helps gathers data to assist in responding to inquires regarding tax matters made by organizations within Exelon. For example, interaction with the Exelon Treasury Department is common to forecast cash flows related to income taxes. (10%) JOB SCOPE Reports directly to the business unit Tax Manager The Tax Department's primary office is in Chicago Illinois with regular travel among the office/business units in the Chicago suburbs and Pennsylvania. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Undergraduate Accounting or other financial discipline 2 year or more years of tax experience 40 hours of ongoing annual continuing professional education will be required of all professionals in the Department (at the Company's expense) Preferred Qualifications Certified Public Accountant or other financial certification and/or advanced degree (JD or MST) preferred Primary Location US-IL-CHICAGO Work Locations Chase Building Chicago Job Accounting & Finance Organization BSC Finance Schedule Full-time Employee Status Regular Job Posting Oct 18, 2022, 10:58:49 AM Unposting Date Ongoing

Primary Purpose Of Position Provide technical and leadership expertise for the IT Systems that support the Exelon Utilities GAS Business. Provide IT teams and business personnel with technology solutions by weighing advantages of technology standards, market availability of products, risks and benefits of technology to meet business/IT needs. (40%) Assist IT Architecture and Engineering community in planning the introduction of new technologies and/or identifying the most appropriate technology choices to accomplish goals by utilizing Exelon's standard governance process as outlined in the Management Model. (15%) Maintain and enhance engagement with business and IT partners, maintain and manage vendor relationships for support vendors including vendor access, ticket management, problem escalation and resolution, and assist with contract management. (10%) Maintain technical knowledge and business acumen within own discipline or function and maintain excellent working relationships with Business Users through regular communications and task assistance. Primary Purpose Of Position This position reports into the Utility Communication (UComm) Department or the Digital Grid Organization and will provide technical expertise to support delivery and maintenance of IT solutions related to the Cyber, Fiber Optics, Firewall, Real Time Networks, SmartGrid, Transport (SONET/DWDM) and Wireless (RF) Communication technologies supporting Exelon. Position will provide technical leadership supporting the engineering, deployment, integration and strategic strategy of high available telecommunications technologies throughout the Exelon Companies in accordance with established strategy and architecture, including leadership supporting the migration away from legacy communications and implementing secure IP based network infrastructure in the substations throughout the Exelon in accordance with established strategy, architecture, NERC/CIP requirements enabling application communication. This role will work in collaboration with the network team, their leadership, enterprise business partners, vendors and project/design teams, in all aspects of the secure & reliable transport of IP networks throughout Exelon's large & complex enterprise and real time operational environments. Primary Duties And Accountabilities Provide technical expertise and/or engineering support for engineering, deployment and operation of IT solutions related to the Cyber, Fiber Optics, Firewall, Real Time Networks, SmartGrid, Transport (SONET/DWDM) and Wireless (RF) Communication technologies supporting Exelon. Skills should include working knowledge of routing and associated protocols that enable the individual to independently perform network design and device configurations. Ability to prepare and write design standards where none exists and maintaining on-going configuration and maintenance of installed infrastructure (40%) Maintain strong relationship working with the Utility business implementing the fiber construction project and on-going maintenance of fiber infrastructure. Interfacing with and managing vendor partners supporting the construction of the fiber infrastructure. (20%) Assist IT Architecture and Engineering community in planning the introduction of new technologies and/or identifying the most appropriate technology choices to accomplish goals based on the Management Model. Ensure appropriate implementation and optimization of resources aligned with approved standards and architecture to meet the Utility Smart Grid application requirements. (15%) Identify and provide Business and IT data on IT trends and issues. Participate in IT architecture review and standards setting. Lead the development of Design Standards, white papers, conducting presentations as needed to explain why a technology is being recommended by IT. (15%) Maintain technical knowledge and business acumen within own discipline or function (5%) Provide performance evaluations, career development feedback, and recognition as required. (5%) JOB SCOPE Maintains deep technical knowledge and broad understanding of utility telecommunications devices tie together to form a cohesive communications architecture including related networking technologies across Exelon. Promotes knowledge via seminars, presentations and publications within IT and Exelon Participates in technological innovation to drive new business opportunities and solve complex business problems Supports Exelon policy, standards and governance while designing solutions or solving issues. Works under minimal supervision. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline and typically 2 to 5 years' experience in telecommunication, electrical, computer engineering and related communication technologies or 6- 9 equivalent combination of education and work experience. Ability to perform detailed telecommunication engineering functions including network management platforms, inventory management and documentation systems. Experience working in a substation environment including detailed understanding of specific requirements and standards for SCADA and system protection communications. Thorough understanding of OSI layers 1, 2 and 3 with emphasis on layer 3 routing and addressing structure including BGP and ISIS routing protocols. Excellent communications skills- Able to effectively communicate highly technical information in non-technical terminology (written a verbal). Understanding of change management principles associated with new technology implementations. Strong organizational skills including the ability to develop a comprehensive configuration management program for telecommunication assets. Understanding of project management principles Preferred Qualifications Technical certification and/or knowledge in Fiber Detailed understanding of NERC/CIP security requirements. Experience with drawing management programs, such as Auto-Cad and MapInfo. Primary Purpose Of Position The VP of Communications & Marketing will be responsible for the development of the vision and implementation of a multi-faceted communications and marketing program to maintain and enhance the positive reputation of three of Exelon’s energy delivery companies in the Mid-Atlantic region—Pepco, Delmarva Power and Atlantic City Electric. As part of Exelon’s Corporate Affairs leadership team, this position leads the effective engagement of all key internal and external stakeholders in service areas encompassing Washington, DC, and parts of Maryland, Delaware and New Jersey to support business outcomes and the achievement of the company’s strategy. Primary Duties And Accountabilities Overall responsibility for design and execution of a comprehensive internal and external communication and marketing strategy using multiple formats and media to maintain and increase awareness of operating company’s key community goals and achievements, differentiate the organization competitively as an environmental and business leader, and cultivate and sustain critical relationships. (30%) Oversee the development and execution of the annual marketing plan and subsequent omni-channel marketing communications plans that support the company’s brand and business strategy. (25%) Maintain open and ongoing communication to exchange relevant information with senior management, other business units and other corporate departments to effectively manage and modify communication and marketing programs; serve as designated point person in all aspects of communications to ensure message continuity, clarity and accuracy. (15%) Integrate departmental strategies and efforts with other external-facing and operational departments to ensure a united focus on business objectives and collaboration on key messages. (10%) Maintain awareness of economic, social and political trends that may affect operating company; make recommendations to aid in the recalibration of strategies and plans accordingly. (10%) Serve as counselor to senior management on communications, marketing, digital, social, and corporate reputation issues. (5%) Cultivate and maintain positive, productive relationships with high level stakeholders, including national and local news media, industry groups and trade associations, vendors, and community leaders. (5%) Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s or graduate degree in journalism, communications, marketing, or related field. The ideal candidate will have at least 15 years of progressively responsible experience and technical know-how in strategic communications in support of marketing and business goals. Proven, successful experience in leading a broad base of internal and external communications functions including key message management, employee communications, speech and presentation support, copywriting and editing, script-writing, and multiple forms of electronic communications including interactive and social networking. Excellent copywriting skills in conjunction with the overall communications plan; effective writing and editing skills for all materials produced by Marketing & Communications as well as other key customers within the organization Strong strategic, creative, and progressive thinking, ability to handle ambiguity, strong attention to detail and well-organized with dependable follow-up and follow-through.. Preferred Qualifications Direct supervision of a team of professional and administrative employees. Interfaces with utility senior leadership, other areas of the company including corporate communications and legislative groups; may be utility spokesperson . Primary Purpose Of Position Responsible for the prioritization and scheduling, of all tasks associated with corrective, preventative and predictive maintenance, projects, switching evolutions and tests associated with a specific discipline within ComEd / PECO. Responsible for the execution and monitoring of the ComEd / PECO Work Management policies, programs and processes. Responsible for scheduling and coordination of all associated support tasks. Schedules and coordinates new business work tasks. Establishes work scope and monitors the performance of the work plan. (30%) Responsible for the execution and monitoring of the Work Management policies, programs and processes. Ensure regional work plan schedule for Operations optimizes resources, allows for emergent workload with minimum impact to schedule, addresses operational priorities, and ensures alignment with Exelon financial, customer, reliability, safety and performance goals. PECO T&S: Manages the interface among Nuclear, Genco, Project Management and TSO to maintain a balance with FEGs, NERC compliance and clearance requests. (10%) Monitor key performance measures, controls, and procedures to ensure the consistent application of the Work Management process across Operations and instill accountability for adherence to the process and completion of planned work. Support organizational adherence to schedules, milestones, key performance measures, controls and procedures for consistent application across operations of the Work Management process, and instill accountability for adherence to the process and completion of planned work. (10%) Chairs or co-chairs the Work screening committee. Performs screening of new action requests and work requests. Interface with other departments in Exelon and represent Work Management regarding process and procedural issues. (15%) Apply a consistent work management model to drive resource sharing. Accountable for decisionmaking in ensuring proper resource shifts. (5%) Support a learning organization that fosters a high performance culture and promotes diversity and inclusion. Serves as a change agent for business initiatives and assures the human element is understood and considered including timely recognition of employees. Use effective performance management to provide accurate and timely feedback and identify opportunities for growth and learning. (5%) Drives the management of backlogs, maintaining a balance between preventative, corrective and elective maintenance work completion for effective continuous material condition improvements. (5%) JOB SCOPE Direct reports: 0 Employees Indirect: 7-23 Employees Direct Budget: $0 Indirect Budget: $30-200 Million Coordination of a large geographically dispersed work force and a large contingent of additional contract resources working within the areas of the ComEd and PECO service territories Coordinate and schedule completion of all tasks associated with new business, preventative maintenance, corrective maintenance, system performance, public improvement, capacity expansion, etc. PECO T&S: Coordinate with TSO, Genco, Nuclear and Project Management to ensure work tasks are planned, scheduled and ready for execution. Ensure all work tasks are scheduled, coordinated and planned to ensure all key performance measures can be attained in Operations.
